WaNoMeta.Description: This WaNo perform the LCmaker to make the linker and center inp file for AuToGraFs

WaNoFile.description: Select a linear (default) linker. Example: alpha.xyz. For more linkers and SBUs, check in Optional
WaNoFile.name: Input file

WaNoString.name: Input format
WaNoString.description: The input file extension(format). Example: xyz

WaNoBool.name: Optional
WaNoBool.description: User-defined linker and SBU features, e.g. dummies, shape etc.

WaNoString.name: Dummy
WaNoString.description: Set indices of atoms (based on their indices in "ase gui") to put dummies near them. Each index should be separated by ",". Example 12,5. To exchange dummies, check "Xplace" below. Default: If it is empty, it finds the carboxylic acids or nitrogen atoms and put the dummies instead or next to them.

WaNoString.name: Remove atoms
WaNoString.description: Set indices of atoms (based on their indices in "ase gui") to remove them (e.g. COOH). Each index should be separated by ",". Example 12,5

WaNoString.name: Output
WaNoString.description: The output name of the linker or SBU (without file extension). Example: linker

WaNoDropDown.name: SBU
WaNoDropDown.description: Set the secondary building units (SBU) type. linker or center

WaNoDropDown.name: Shape
WaNoDropDown.description: Set the Shape of SBU from the list

WaNoBool.name: Xplace
WaNoBool.description: If you want to replace dummies with the atoms in the dummy option, turn on this option. Default: It puts dummies at the near of the atoms indexed in dummy, or the dummies that it finds them automatically.

WaNoBool.name: AuToGraFs
WaNoBool.description: The path to the AuToGraFs directory where the mol2inp file is there. Dont Change it if it works. Default: /shared/software/chem/MOFsofts/autografs

WaNoDropDown.name: Linker_type
WaNoDropDown.description: If you want the xyz file for the new version of AuToGraFs(equal or greater than version 2.0), please select xyz. Default: for Autografs before version 2.0, which creates inp linkers and centers.

WaNoTemplate.WaNoExecCommand: #source /shared/software/anaconda3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh module load MOFsofts python LCmaker_input.py PYTHON3=$(which python3) conda activate py2 #export PATH=/shared/software/anaconda3/envs/py2/bin/:$PATH #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/shared/software/anaconda3/envs/py2/lib/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH PYTHON2=$(which python2) LCMAKER=$(which LCmaker) $PYTHON3 $LCMAKER $(cat options) python LCmaker_report.py
